titleStmt.title: Flora Ohler v. George and Charles S. Shafer. Return and Answer.

bibl.title: Flora Ohler v. George and Charles S. Shafer.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

keywords.term: Third Judicial District Court of Nebraska

div1.p:
In the District Court of Lancaster County, Nebraska. In the Matter of the Application ) of Flora Ohler for a writ of ) Return and answer to petition. Habeas Corpus. ) The respondent, Charles Shafer
386.
23-85 IN RE APPLICATION OF FLORA OHLER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
for answer and return to the writ of Habeas Corpus issued in this case says:

1st Admits that A.J. Cornish is one of the Judges of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of the state of Nebraska, and that the petitioner, Flora Ohler is the mother of Naomi Geilday and is now deceased; that the said Naomi Gielday is a minor, 14 years of age and upwards, to wit the age of fourteen years and eight months and that the said Charles Shafer is not at this time deputy sheriff, coroner, constable of this state or United States. 2nd. This respondent, Charles Shafer further answering says that Naomi Gielday is a minor over the age of 14 years to wit of the age of fourteen years and eight months; Sometime in January, 1893, in an action pending in said Lancaster County the marriage theretofore existed between the said Flora Ohler and Jospeh S. Gielday was annulled, and that thereupon the said Joseph S. Gielday in the year of 1893 removed from said Lancaster County to Red Willow County and State of Nebraska where he resided and was a freeholder and elector of said county from the time of removing to said Red Willow County to until the time of his death on the 11th day of February, 1898, and the said Flora Ohler removed from said Lancaster County to the State of Iowa, where she now resides and has for more than a year last past. That since the decree of divorce and before the death of said Joseph Gielday herein before mentioned the said Flora Ohler has been twice married. And each of said husbands were living at the time of the death of said Joseph S. Geilday. That said Naomi Geilday came to said Red Willow County on the 20th day of Novemeber, 1893, and ever since and up to the present time has been and is now a resident pf Red Willow County, Nebraska, and ever since the commencement of her residence in said Red Willow County has been under the care, charge and custody of her father up to the time of his death on the 11th day of February, 1898. A short time after the death of the said Joseph S. Geilday his daughter the said Naomi Gailday, being more than fourteen years of age, came to the residence of this respondent and asked to be permitted to make her home with the family of this respondent and asked to be permitted to make her home with the family of this respondent. The said Naomi Geilday having no father, morther, sister, brother or other relatives in said Red Willow County and state of Nebraska with whom she could make her home; thereupon the said Naomi Geilday, and thereupon on the 21st day of April, 1898 in said county Court a hearing was duly had before the county judge of said Red Willow County as to the appointment of this respondent as guardian of the said Naomi Gailday, at which time and place it was then and there adjudged by the said court that this respondent be, and this respondent was then and there duly appointed guardian of the person and property of the said Naomi Geilday. Thereupon this respondent duly qualified by giving bond and taking the oath of office, and ever since said 21st day of April, 1898, and up to the present time this respondent has been and is now the guardian of the person and property of the said Naomi Geilday. and the said Naomi Geilday by her own desire
23-85 IN RE APPLICATION FLORA OHLER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
and without any restraint at any time whatever has been since the 14th day of February, 1898, residing with the family of this respondent.

Prior to the said 21st day of April, 1898, to-wit: On the 9th day of March, 1898, on notice duly given, a hearing was duly had as to the appointment of this respondent as administrator of the estate of the said Joseph S. Geilday, and on the 9th day of March, 1898, this respondent was duly appointed by the County Court of said Red Willow County, Nebraska, administrator, thereupon this respondent duly qualified by giving bond and taking the oath of office, and ever since the said 9th day of March, 1898, this respondent has been, and now is the administrator of the estate of the said Joseph S. Geilday, deceased.

This respondent now is and has been for more than nine years last past, a resident, elector, freeholder, and tax-payer of said Red Willow County, Nebraska. This respondent is informed and believes that the said Flora Ohler is a non-resident of the State of Nebraska, and resides at Hamburg, Iowa.

Hon. George S. Bishop is the duly elected, qualified and acting County Judge of said Red Willow County, and has been acting as such county judge for more than three months last past, and having an office in McCook, Nebraska, the county-seat of Red Willow County. During the 3rd day of May, 1898, and ever since, up to the present time, the said George S. Bishop has been in said county discharging the duties of his said office, and during office hours in the Court House in the county seat of said Red Willow County, and is no way disqualified from hearing this application of the said Flora Ohler for a writ of habeas corpus in this matter. Honorable George W. Norris, is the District Judge of the 14th Judicial District of the State of Nebraska, and of said Red Willow County, resides at Beaver City, not to exceed 25 miles from the resident of this respondent and of the said Naomi Geilday, and is in no way disqualified from acting in this matter. This respondent is informed and believes that said George W. Norris, District Judge as aforesaid, was at Beaver City on the 3rd day of May, 1898, and could be easily found at said place and has been continuously in said district for more than ten days last past and is now in said district. At the time of filing the complaint in this matter and at the time of issuing this writ and serving the same this respondent and the said Naomi Geilday were at their residence in said Red Willow County, and in compliance to said writ and against their will this respondent and the said Naomi Geilday are now before this honorable Court answering the writ in this action.
Therefore and by reason of the foregoing, this court has no jurisdiction over the person of this respondent or the said Naomi Geilday.

3rd. This respondent as such guardian duly appointed is entitled to the care and custody of the said Naomi Geilday. The said Naomi Geilday desires to remain and reside with the family of this respondent and desires that he shall act as her guardian, and the said Naomi Geilday has been in no manner restrained of her liberty, and her residing with the family of this respondent, and
23-85 IN RE APPLICATION FLORA OHLER FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
